buildup.text: Active listening consumes significant cognitive resources: attention, working memory, emotional processing, and more.

discovery.text: Stanford research on 'Zoom fatigue' found that video calls are more draining because of constant close-up eye contact.

twist.text: Listening fatigue isn't weakness. It's a signal that your brain has been working hard.

climax.text: Managing listening energy is a skill: take breaks, reduce visual clutter, and schedule deep listening for when you're.

punchline.text: Listening is a muscle. It tires. Rest it, and it works better.
